channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: ‘Exhausted all options’ — Unbanked to close after being left hanging by investor
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Unbanked is yet another crypto firm to wind down this month, joining BottlePay, HotBit, Teressa, and most recently, TradeBlock.

item.title: Crypto firm Gemini picks Ireland as European base amid US crypto blues
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Cameron Winklevoss has predicted a “Cambrian explosion” in European innovation once regulations are rolled out.

item.title: French lawmakers agree to loosen rules in proposed crypto influencer bill
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Previously, the bill restricted influencer marketing to only licensed crypto firms, of which there are currently none in France.

item.title: Microsoft urges lawmakers, companies to ‘step up’ with AI guardrails
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Microsoft President Brad Smith is the latest tech industry heavyweight to call for better risk management and regulation for artificial intelligence.

item.title: Chinese TV’s crypto ‘bull run’ report censored, Multichain crisis: Asia Express
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Chinese state TV’s crypto news report gets memory holed, Multichain token plunges as arrest rumors swirl, memecoin hype subsides, and more.

item.title: RGB protocol may offer solution to Bitcoin's Ordinals jam, claims proponent
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: The founder of Digital Bitcoin Art and Assets (DIBA) believes smart contracts on Bitcoin could solve the myriad problems created by Ordinals.

item.title: Digital Currency Group to shutter institutional trading unit TradeBlock
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Starting May 31, TradeBlock will commence the official procedure of winding down its operations.

item.title: DeSantis looks like the choice for crypto enthusiasts in 2024
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By J.W. Verret
item.category: Ron DeSantis understands the ethos of crypto
according to J.W. Verret. For crypto holders
that puts him ahead of the pack in the 2024 presidential race.
item.description: Ron DeSantis understands the ethos of cryptocurrency. For single-issue crypto holders, that puts him ahead of the pack in the 2024 presidential race.

item.title: WEF publishes crypto asset regulation recommendations for government, industry
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The World Economic Forum analyzed regulatory approaches to urge cooperation between international organizations, regulators and the crypto industry.

item.title: This bearish technical pattern hints at a double-digit drop in Bitcoin price
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Inflation concerns and the U.S. debt standoff cast a long shadow over Bitcoin’s dwindling bullish prospects.

item.title: Bitpanda secures licensing agreement with Coinbase as part of strategic partnership
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: As part of the collaboration, Bitpanda will incorporate Coinbase Exchange into its roster of authorized liquidity providers.

item.title: Norway could go its own way on crypto asset regulation, central bank suggests
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: International regulation may be too slow and may represent interests that are not in line with Norway’s, Norges Bank suggests in an annual report.

item.title: Meta’s new Megabyte system solves one of the biggest roadblocks for GPTs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Researchers at Meta AI may have developed a way to get around the “tokenization” problem with GPT models.

item.title: 7 central banks and BIS continue examination of ongoing policy issues for retail CBDC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Bank for International Settlements has published the fifth paper by the group, highlighting its latest thinking on a potential retail CBDC.

item.title: Binance suspends deposits for bridged tokens, seeks clarity from Multichain team
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Transactions on the Multichain protocol have been delayed across multiple cross-chain bridges without a clear explanation.

item.title: Debt ceiling crisis: Best practices to navigate this market
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Adrian J. Permal
item.description: Join us as we discuss the current U.S. debt ceiling crisis and what it means for Bitcoin and the crypto market.

item.title: Synthetix (SNX) trading volume overtakes GMX, but is the DEX token rally sustainable?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: Volumes at Synthetix surpassed its nearest DEX competitor, but contracting user activity across decentralized exchanges could be a red flag.

item.title: DeFi protocol WDZD Swap exploited for $1.1M: CertiK
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The reported attacker is a known exploiter, labeled "Fake_Phishing750" by BSCScan.

item.title: Ripe for the squeeze? Bitcoin mining stocks remain under attack from short sellers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By JJ
item.description: BTC price has struggled for nearly a month, but Bitcoin miners revenue is up, calling into question the logic of short sellers betting against mining stocks.

item.title: Bitcoin losing its 200-week trendline puts $20K in play — BTC price analysis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price action gives analysts reasons to be bearish, while Bitcoin shuns volatility from the day’s macro triggers.

item.title: Sam Altman’s Worldcoin secures $115M for decentralized ID
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Funds will be used to support the decentralized World ID and the recently released crypto wallet World App. VC firms A16z Crypto, Bain Capital Crypto, and Distributed Global are investors in the round.

item.title: OpenAI warns European officials over upcoming AI regulations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman spoke with European officials in Brussels, warning of the ramifications of over-regulation of the AI industry.

item.title: In the US, targeted crypto legislation ‘could start the ball rolling’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Singer
item.description: Is the EU’s crypto regulatory framework a useful model for U.S. legislators? Can a “security” token really morph into a “utility” token?

item.title: Home loans using crypto as collateral: Do the risks outweigh the reward?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: You can use crypto as collateral to get a home loan — but as one Bitcoin OG found out, it’s super risky and you can lose the lot.

item.title: Nvidia AI chip value skyrockets amid AI development boom
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The chip developer released its second-quarter revenue forecast, which was 50% higher than market estimates, followed by a 28% increase in company shares.

item.title: Circle launches euro-based stablecoin on Avalanche blockchain
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Circle launched EUROC last year as a regulated stablecoin, which means that each token is fully backed by euro reserves held at United States-regulated financial institutions.

item.title: EU watchdog warns about the risk of a bank run on stablecoins
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The European Systemic Risk Board suggests more disclosures and monitoring to fight the risks of the crypto market.

item.title: Account abstraction could change how institutions interact with Ethereum — Safe co-founder
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elisha Owusu Akyaw
item.description: In episode 21 of Hashing It Out, Lukas Schor, co-founder of Safe, explains that account abstraction could change how instructions and DAOs interact with the Ethereum blockchain.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price down today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: why is the crypto market down
is crypto in a bear market
when will bitcoin price go up
item.description: Bitcoin price is down today as investors' focus shifts toward the U.S. dollar, which has surged to a two-month high.

item.title: Germany’s recession triggers responses from the crypto community
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: One community member thinks that, in this case, all speculative markets, including crypto, will lose ground.
